result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles L Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence, including the sentence in case #15CM918.

miscConds.notes:
09-25-15/ Michelle A Havas
Court sets restitution at $0.

Restitution hearing scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA).  Court will waive all costs, fees, and surcharges that it is able to, due to an inability to pay.
Pay a DNA surcharge.

Complete a domestic violence class.
Absolute sobriety.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles L Johnson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Copy electronically sent to DOC showing no restitution
Defendant Charles L Johnson not in court, Defendant in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court ordered restitution to be set at ZERO.

Defendant Charles L Johnson in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Negotiations placed on the record. Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 5 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 2 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence, including the sentence in case #15CM918.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 18 MONTHS probation.

  Conditions of Probation:
-Complete a domestic violence class
-Absolute sobriety
-No contact with Jessica B.
-No possession of firearms
-Pay a DNA surcharge
-Obtain/maintain employment

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
-All mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA).  Court will waive all costs, fees, and surcharges that it is able to, due to an inability to pay.

Appeal rights given.

Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit


 Case adjourned to Branch 23. All parties are notified that effective September 14, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Michelle Ackerman Havas, Branch 45, in Room 515 of the Courthouse due to the rotation of Judge Grady in Branch 23.  Restitution hearing scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
submitted by the State received and filed.

Defendant Charles L Johnson in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
For reasons stated on the record, parties request an adjourned sentencing date. Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Charles L Johnson in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

ON motion of the state, Court ordered the penalty enhancer of "use of a Dangerous Weapon :  Dismissed. 

 Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as  to the Amended charge in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered. 

To be resolved with other matters in branch 45.   Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 45.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 07-17-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Charles L Johnson in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CMC. Case remains set for Trial. Case adjourned to branch 47 for Jury Trial on 7/13/2015 at 8:30 am.
Received and Filed, State's Witness List.
Received and Filed, State's Requested Jury Instructions.
Received and Filed, State's Motion in Limine.

Defendant Charles L Johnson in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case set for Final Pretrial. State's motion for joinder denied but the Court. Defense requests an adjourned Jury Trial date. Court granted defense request and vacated the Jury Trial on 5/27/2015. State requests another Final Pretrial. Court granted state's request. State's offer will remain open until the Final Pretrial date. Case adjourned to branch 47.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
State filed notice of motion and motion for joinder for trial. lr

Defendant Charles L Johnson in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 47. State will be filing an amended complaint at the final pretrial. lr  Jury trial scheduled for 05-27-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Charles L Johnson in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 47. lr  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 03-05-2015 at 08:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: JESSICA B.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Charles L Johnson in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  
Defendant Charles L Johnson in custody.  
Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47. 
Defense moves to Dismiss 'Penalty Enhancer". Arguments heard. Court DENIED defense motion.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
